page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: Farming within our area is{Hill Sheep {Farming}on farms owned by Balnaboth Estate and Airlie Estate. We visited and suveyed the largest farm on our patch. The SPOTT FARM is a hill sheep farm with a total area of 2800 acres.The hill area is 2680 acres and the arable area is 120 acres. It has been farmed for 4 generations (140 years) by the White family. The present farmer is Mrs. P. Paton, daughter of Mr A White. There are 120 acres of rotational crops. This year there is 4 and a half acres of swede turnips, 14 acres of spring barley and 15 acres of forage rape.The turnips are pulled and fed to the cattle in the winter.The sheep go on to the rape in autumn to eat it.The spring barley is for feeding and the straw is baled for bedding the cattle in the winter.
